Lunch.description: Delicious noodle dish with a kik
ingredients: 4 3.5 oz instant ramen/any noodle of choice
seasonings: garlic salt, seasoning salt, pepper, salt
a splash of rice wine vinegar
optional: some vegetables and some kind of protein

steps.header: Salt a pot of water and bring it to a boil
steps.step: Cook the noodles 3-5 mins and put in a bowl aside. While cooking cut up the peppers and mince the garlic.

steps.header: Heat up the oil
steps.step: When the oil is hot throw the garlic and peppers in the pan. Then throw in the seasonings, chile flakes, and sugar then mix again. Lastly, pour in the soy sauce, sesame oil, and vinegar.

steps.header: Put the noodles, vegetables, and protein in the pan
steps.step: Mix everything together then serve.

ingredients: seasonings: garlic salt, seasoning salt, pepper, salt

steps.header: Heat up the oil
steps.step: Put in a piece or two of rice if the oil starts popping it is ready.

steps.header: Put in the garlic cloves and mix
steps.step: mix in the rice and the seasonings. Then you can add any vegetables or protein you want.

steps.header: Let it cook for 10 or so minutes to get the bottom crispy.
steps.step: Finally, mix in the sesame oil and serve.

steps.header: Preheat oven to 400 degrees
steps.step: Poke holes in the potato/es and cover them with the oil, salt, and pepper

steps.header: Bake the potatoes for 45 minutes or until soft and squishy
steps.step: Cut a slit down the potato and put the guts it in a bowl. Mix in the seasonings, cheese, and whatever other toppings you prefer.

steps.header: Put the guts on some aluminum foil or back in the potato shell
steps.step: Cover the potato with cheese and/or bacon, bake for another 10 minutes or so, and enjoy.

steps.header: Pore about an inch or two of oil and turn on the stove
steps.step: While that is preheating season the steaks and get two bowls for the batter

steps.header: Prepare the wet and dry batters
steps.step: For the dry batter, mix together the flour, corn meal, and the seasonings. For the wet batter, mix a little soy sauce, milk, and optionally add an egg.

steps.header: Batter the steaks
steps.step: Dip them in the wet, then the dry, back in the wet, and back in the dry.

steps.header: Fry your steaks for 3-5 minutes per side
steps.step: Once done place on a cooling rack to drain the oil.

steps.header: For the gravy
steps.step: In a pan take the used oil and stir together a 50/50 mix of flour and oil constantly stirring for 1-2 minutes.

steps.header: Thin it out with some milk
steps.step: Cook until thickened for about 2-3 minutes while constantly stirring and enjoy!

steps.header: Brown the ground beef
steps.step: Add your seasonings to the beef when you begin cooking.

steps.header: Optional: drain the grease
steps.step: After draining, add your taco seasoning and a little water.

steps.header: Let cook down about for 10 minutes
steps.step: Add the meat to the shells put on the toppings and enjoy.

steps.header: Bring a pot of salt and water to a boil
steps.step: While waiting, trim the chicken and cut it into bite sized pieces.

steps.header: Cook the noodles for about 7-10 minutes
steps.step: While noodles are cooking, put oil in a pan and add the chicken. Season with the soy sauce and some seasonings. Cook for at least 10 minutes.

steps.header: Add the noodles and vegetables to the chicken and mix well.
steps.step: Add a little bit of the pasta water, the heavy cream, and the parmesan. If the noodles are sticking together to much add a little more pasta water.

steps.header: Let it cook till creamy and hot
Optional: make your alfredo sauce
steps.step: Melt the butter with some garlic salt and pepper. Once melted whisk in the heavy cream until creamy and warm. Mix in the parmesan until melted. Enjoy!

steps.header: Preheat oven to 400 degrees
steps.step: wash the potatoes and then make thin cuts in the them making sure you don't cut all the way through. Tip: you can use two chopsticks to prevent the knife from cutting all the way through.

steps.header: Brush the potatoes with oil
steps.step: put the oil in a bowl and mix in salt and pepper. Then brush the oil mixture in the cracks.

steps.header: Season the potatoes
steps.step: season the potatoes with your favorite seasonings, and throw them in the oven for 45 minutes or until soft and squishy.

steps.header: Put cheese in every crack
steps.step: Put the potatoes back in the oven to melt the cheese and enjoy.

steps.header: Preheat oven to 400 degrees
steps.step: Poke holes in the potato/es and cover them with the oil, salt, and pepper

steps.header: Bake the potatoes for 45 minutes or until soft and squishy
steps.step: Cut a slit down the potato and put the guts it in a bowl. Mix in the seasonings, cheese, and whatever other toppings you prefer.

steps.header: Put the guts on some aluminum foil or back in the potato shell
steps.step: Cover the potato with cheese and/or bacon, bake for another 10 minutes or so, and enjoy.

steps.header: Preheat oven to 400 degrees
steps.step: Poke holes in the potato/es and cover them with the oil or bacon grease, salt, and pepper

steps.header: Bake the potatoes for 45 minutes or until soft and squishy
steps.step: Once done cut the potatoes in half and scoop out most of the guts. In the potato shell, put in a small amount of butter, fill with cheese, and top with bacon and some seasonings.

steps.header: Bake for another 10 minutes
steps.step: Enjoy!

steps.header: Preheat oven to 350 degrees
steps.step: Mix the chocolate cake mix, eggs, pudding, oil, and water together and put the mixture in a pan.

steps.header: Bake for 30 minutes or until inside is cooked
steps.step: While that is baking mix together the powdered sugar, water, and chocolate chips.

steps.header: Poke a bunch of small holes in the top of the cake
steps.step: Spread the glaze around the cake while it is still hot and enjoy.
